column4: anyone has experience in setting up a server at home? is a UPS needed?
an UPS is needed if you want the server to be running during a powerfailure, otherwise no.
is a broadband connection good enough for uptime?
I would say it is good enough for a server running 24/7.
the connection I used was a normal ASDL connection.
what's the outgoing bandwidth?
512kbit
what can a 512 kbit bandwidth do for a server?
what do you mean, do for a server?
is the going bandwidth too little for a server?
-- ohh.. well, I used my server for FTP, www, mailserver, irc-bouncer, irc-bots, and some other stuff
but it depends very much on what you what to do with the server -- what kind of apps. you will be running.
oops! even a ftp server  the download speed is awful, right?
i need to make a CMS
well, the download speed was not that good, so I think you might wanna consider more upload-bw, if you're going to run a CMS...
yes...but a dedicated line is very expensive...
that is very true :) -- But, if the CMS doesn't include alot of graphics, a 512kbit should be enough.
but I haven't got a lot of experience with CMS, so im a little on soft ground.
your right a CMS without much graphics doesn't use much bw
are you going to make your own CMS, or a allready made one? -- If you're going to use a allready made one, you could try at their FAQ, about the generated traffic.
i use Joomla
